exteriorImages.description: The 2013 Ford C-MAX Energi (shown in Ice Storm) makes an impression with its modern design and sporty style- even standing still.
Introducing the 2013 C-MAX Energi, the first-ever production plug-in hybrid electric vehicle by Ford. Shown in Ice Storm with optional features.

The first production plug-in hybrid vehicle from Ford, the C-MAX Energi is equipped with an illuminated charge port conveniently located near the driver’s door for easy plug-in access. When you plug the connector cord into the charge port, it activates the LED ring around the port to indicate that it’s connected. When the ring is flashing, it means a charge is in progress. When the ring is solidly lit, the vehicle is fully charged.
The 2013 C-MAX Hybrid SEL shown in Sterling Gray Metallic.

The available rear view camera provides a video image of the area behind your vehicle on a color touch screen. Color bars help you judge how far behind you objects are. The system works in conjunction with the Rear Parking Aid by alerting you with audio tones while you’re backing up.

The new, available foot-Activated Liftgate is incredibly easy to use. With the available Intelligent Access key in your pocket or purse, just place your foot under the bumper and the power liftgate will automatically open, providing easy access to the cargo area.
Once the available active park assist is activated, your C-MAX Hybrid or C-MAX Energi can virtually parallel park itself with little input from you. Shown with optional features.
The 2013 C-MAX Hybrid and C-MAX Energi set the stage for style, versatility and efficiency. C-MAX Hybrid shown in Sterling Gray. C-MAX Energi shown in Blue Candy.

The new powertrain includes a 2.0L I-4 Atkinson-cycle engine with an electric motor. Together they generate 188 total system horsepower, best-in-class* for the C-MAX Hybrid, delivering the responsive power you want when you need it. Even more impressive, C-MAX Hybrid has an EPA-estimated rating of up to 45 city/40 hwy/43 combined mpg.**
Using a combination of brake and/or engine control, all-speed traction control helps maximize available traction on slippery or loose surfaces. Standard on the new 2013 C-MAX Hybrid and C-MAX Energi.

AdvanceTrac<sup>®</sup> with Roll Stablity Control<sup>™</sup> is an electronic stability system that enhances control on slippery surfaces. It features a vehicle-roll-motion sensor that directly measures the vehicle’s roll rate at least 100 times every second.
The SOS Post-Crash Alert System<sup>™</sup> activates the horn and emergency flashers in the event of airbag deployment. After the system is activated, you may deactivate it using your key fob.
The C-MAX Hybrid and C-MAX Energi both benefit from powersplit architecture. This allows the vehicle to drive in either electric mode, gas mode, or a combination of both.
The Active Grille Shutters on the C-MAX help reduce air resistance and increase fuel efficiency.
2013 C-MAX Hybrid SEL shown in Ice Storm Metallic.

To charge the high-voltage, state-of-the-art lithium-ion battery of the C-MAX Energi more quickly, Ford recommends the optional 240-volt Leviton charging station. It’s compact and portable, making it easy to take along if you relocate.
How efficient is the 2013 C-MAX? Enough to get everyone talking. C-MAX Hybrid has an EPA estimated rating of up to 45 city/40 hwy/43 combined mpg.* That’s an EPA-estimated range of 522 miles.
C-MAX Hybrid SEL shown in Ruby Red Metallic Tinted Clearcoat.
The C-MAX Hybrid can operate electrically up to 85 miles per hour*, allowing the traction motor to power the vehicle, providing maximum efficiency.

interiorImages.description: The multi-activity vehicle design offers ample interior space and flexibility in the all-new five-passenger C-MAX. Shown with optional features.

The available 8-inch touch-screen display in the center stack allows the driver to easily engage, providing real-time information to help you get the most from your C-MAX Hybrid or C-MAX Energi. This high-tech design seamlessly interacts with all the other SYNC<sup>®</sup><sup>27</sup> functionality such as voice-activated calling, music, and much more.

The next-generation SmartGauge<sup>®</sup> with EcoGuide is the perfect companion to your C-MAX Hybrid or C-MAX Energi. The high-tech system provides real-time information featuring the next-generation design of green leaves growing across the screen on a lush green vine to indicate driving efficiency.
The second-row seat in the C-MAX Hybrid can easily and quickly be folded down with the 60/40 split, providing a flat load floor.
C-MAX is full of versatilty, inside and out. With a convenient 60/40 split in the second row seat, you have room for more cargo - when you need it.

C-MAX is clever as well as versatile. If you want to store smaller items and keep everything out of view, there’s hidden compartments in the footwell of the second row behind the first-row seats. Just lift up the floor mats and discover a smart hiding place for your PC tablet and other small items.
Bring the music along. The second-row seat in the C-MAX Hybrid can be easily and quickly folded down with the 60/40 split, providing a flat load floor.

Arms full and trying to open the liftgate? Not a problem. With the C-MAX Hybrid and C-MAX Energi, you have the convenience of a class exclusive* available foot-activated liftgate. With a simple kick of your foot under the bumper, the liftgate opens. No hands needed!
Let the sunshine in, thanks to the available panoramic fixed glass roof. A power sunshade is included and can be opened at the touch of a button.

To help keep you and your front-seat passenger comfortable when the mercury drops, opt for the heated front seats with four comfort settings. They’re standard on the C-MAX Hybrid SEL and C-MAX Energi; available with the cloth seats on the Hybrid SE in the Winter Package.
The C-MAX Hybrid SEL with leather-trimmed seats.

exteriorImages.description: The Ford Taurus is athletic and assertive with a wide stance and bold, chiseled lines. The trapezoid grille and front fascia opening complement the muscular lines of the hood.
With twin independent variable cam timing, the 3.5L Ti-VCT V6 engine works on demand to help deliver peak efficiency and quick off-the-line acceleration.
The high-performance Taurus SHO in Ruby Red Metallic Tinted Clearcoat and optional 20" optional wheels.
Dynamic, angular lines draw your eye to the bold, aggressive grille.
The Taurus SHO attacks all roads with impressive power, performance and handling.
While sporty-looking, the aerodynamic rear spoiler on the Taurus SHO helps contribute to efficiency and stability.
Taurus SHO features a unique sport-tuned suspension, designed to deliver impressive road holding, cornering agility and steering responsiveness. Shown in Sunset Metallic.
The standard 3.5L Ti-VCT V6 engine in Taurus SE, SEL and Limited models is equipped with the performance and efficiency benefits of twin independent variable camshaft timing.

The 2014 Ford Taurus has best-in-class fuel economy when equipped with available 2.0L EcoBoost<sup>®</sup> engine.* It combines the technologies of direct injection and turbocharging plus twin independent variable camshaft timing (Ti-VCT). The result is 240 horsepower and 270 lb.-ft. of torque,** a performance you would expect from a larger engine. It’s a win-win combination: the power of a V6 and efficiency of a 4-cylinder engine.

Taurus SHO is powered by the 3.5L EcoBoost<sup>®</sup> V6. EcoBoost combines two different technologies - turbocharging and direct-injection - to deliver V8 performance along with V6 fuel economy.* It generates 365 horsepower and 350 lb.-ft. of torque across a wide 1,500-5,000 rpm range.**
Curve Control, standard on all Taurus models, will slow you down when it senses that you are going too fast through a particular curve.
Taurus Limited in Tuxedo Black Metallic with available 20" polished aluminum wheels, rear spoiler and moonroof.
The Taurus SHO is engineered with a true dual exhaust system, meaning that each of the engine’s two exhaust manifolds has its own exhaust pipe, reducing back pressure and enhancing horsepower.
Taurus SHO offers exhilarating performance and handling for the true driving enthusiast.
Among the standard features on the Taurus SHO are high-intensity discharge headlamps and unique Piano Black mesh in the bold grille.
The Piano Black mesh grille sets the SHO dramatically apart in the Taurus 4-model lineup.
The high-performance Taurus SHO in Ruby Red Metallic Tinted Clearcoat and optional 20" machined 5-spoke wheels with painted black pockets.
A wide variety of attractive wheel options and an aggressive, wide stance give Taurus substantial presence on the road.
Taurus Limited in Tuxedo Black Metallic with available moonroof, rear spoiler and 20" polished aluminum wheels.

interiorImages.description: The choice is yours in the high-performance Taurus SHO: leather-trimmed seats with embroidered SHO graphics or leather-trimmed seats with Mayan Gray Miko<sup>®</sup> suede inserts and embroidered SHO graphics in the front seats.
The interior of the Taurus is thoughtfully designed, with attention to detail throughout the cabin.
The Navigation System is available in Taurus SEL, Limited, and SHO models.
Everything is in place to keep you fully connected to the world while on the road.
The interior offers plenty of space and premium touch points.
Taurus Limited comes with perforated leather-trimmed front bucket seats with 10-way power adjustment for both the driver and passenger. The driver’s seat also includes memory feature.

Available SYNC<sup>®</sup> with MyFord Touch<sup>®</sup> features two color LCD screens in the instrument cluster, an 8-inch color LCD touch-screen in the center console, along with steering wheel controls that let you personalize your display and settings while keeping your hands on the wheel.*
Technology is the true force behind Taurus, with features that help keep you fully engaged in the driving experience.
Taurus Limited comes with 60/40 split rear seats with perforated leather detail. Heated outboard rear seats are available on Taurus Limited and SHO models.

Both you and your front passenger can relax in heated or cooled front seats* with three temperature settings. Perforated leather trim helps provide comfort no matter what the outside temperature is. And you can put having to grab onto a cold steering wheel in the past with the available heated steering wheel, which is easily turned on or off with the icon on the 8-inch color LCD touch screen.

Taurus front seats, including SHO, offer an extended thigh support cushion and bolster contour for driving comfort. The soy-based seat cushions, seat backs and the four-way adjustable (up/down/tilt) head restraints are supportive and comfortable as well as environmentally friendly.

Taurus offers advanced technology features such as available BLIS<sup>®</sup> (Blind Spot Information System) with cross-traffic alert as well as adaptive cruise control and collision warning with brake support. Available on Limited and SHO.

The Edge Limited comes with many premium features, among them: SYNC® with MyFord Touch® and the Sony® Audio System with 10 speakers and HD Radio™.

The available stowable bed extender provides additional cargo space when in the outward position while the tailgate is down. It can also be flipped inward to create a contained area at the back of the box when the tailgate is up. When not in use, it conveniently stows neatly into the sides of the cargo box.
The F-150 can tow a boat or trailer up to 11,300 pounds when properly equipped.
F-150 STX in Blue Flame Metallic. STX sports a black grille with body-color surround.
F-150 Limited in Blue Jeans Metallic.

Shown are two class-exclusive* F-150 features: The box side steps deploy with just the tap of a foot for convenient access to the pickup bed. The integrated tailgate step stows inside the tailgate, is easily accessed and includes a handy flip-up grab bar.

Standard trailer sway control (TSC) builds on AdvanceTrac<sup>®</sup> with RSC<sup>®</sup> to help maintain trailer control.<sup>39</sup> The F-150 LARIAT SuperCrew<sup>®</sup> 4x2 is shown here in Ruby Red Metallic Tinted Clearcoat with the LARIAT Chrome Package and other available equipment.
F-150 STX in Race Red with Sport Package.

The F-150 is built with pride at the Dearborn, MI, and Kansas City, MO, Ford truck plants. The F-150 LARIAT SuperCrew<sup>®</sup> 4x4 in Ruby Red Metallic Tinted Clearcoat with the LARIAT Chrome Package and other available equipment shown.
F-150 XLT SuperCrew<sup>®</sup> in Race Red with the XLT Chrome Package and other available equipment.
The Built Ford Tough<sup>®</sup> F-150 is ready to get the day’s work done.

The F-150 FX4 is designed to help make your job easier. Shown in Sterling Gray Metallic with the available class-exclusive* integrated tailgate step and box side steps, plus other available equipment.

The F-150 features an available class-exclusive* integrated tailgate step with a 350-lb. load capacity. This ultra-convenient step stows inside the tailgate, can be easily accessed when needed and includes a handy flip-up grab bar.
Towing a Class V boat or trailer is fully within the capability of the Ford F-150 with its maximum tow rating of 11,300 pounds when properly equipped.
F-150 FX2 shown with FX Appearance Package.
F-150 XLT shown with Chrome Package.
F-150 FX4 shown with optional 20-inch premium painted 6-spoke aluminum wheels.
The available electronic-locking rear differential, when engaged, locks the rear axle completely to provide maximum traction at both rear wheels at the same time.
People who work hard count on Ford F-150 to handle the tough jobs, from heavy construction to farming to oil production. F-150 gets it done with capability, power and efficiency. No compromises.
F-150 LARIAT shown with Chrome Package.
F-150 LARIAT shown with Chrome Package.
F-150 XLT shown with Chrome Package.
F-150 XLT and LARIAT, both shown with Chrome Package.

The no-cost F-150 SSV (Special Service Vehicle) Package is available in SuperCab or SuperCrew<sup>®</sup> configuration, 4×2 or 4×4, and powered by a 5.0L V8 or 3.5L EcoBoost<sup>®</sup> engine. The SSV-equipped F-150 interior is optimized for comfort, adaptability for aftermarket task-specific accessories, and 2nd-row seat durability. SSV content includes a high-capacity 220-amp alternator to support fleet-class electrical needs.
F-150 XLT shown with Chrome Package.
F-150 XLT shown with Chrome Package.

interiorImages.description: Voice-activated Ford SYNC<sup>®</sup><sup>27</sup> included in most F-150 models, lets you keep your hands on the wheel and eyes on the road. Optional in XL and STX; standard in all other models.
F-150 FX4 with FX Appearance Package.

Behind the front seats of the F-150 SuperCrew,<sup>®</sup> you have the most usable cab space in its class.* No buttons to push or levers to pull. Simply use one hand to fold up the mechanically articulating rear seats inside the F-150 SuperCrew against the back of the cab.
The 4-door Super Crew shows its impressive people- and cargo-carrying versatility. Seat up to six. Or fold down the rear seats for extra in-cab storage.

Toughness meets luxury in the F-150 Limited, featuring leather-trimmed bucket seats and a list of conveniences including dual-zone electronic automatic climate control, SYNC<sup>®</sup> with MyFord Touch,<sup>®</sup> Navigation System, Remote Start System, 700-watt Audio System from Sony<sup>®</sup> with HD Radio™ Technology, and much more.
Sony<sup>®</sup> is a registered trademark of Sony<sup>®</sup> Corporation. HD Radio is a proprietary trademark of iBiquity Digital Corp.
F-150 XL interior in Steel Gray with optional equipment.

Available voice-activated SYNC<sup>®</sup> with MyFord Touch<sup>®</sup><sup>27</sup> is one of the smartest tools you’ll use every day. SYNC lets you make calls, get directions, access your entertainment system and a whole lot more.
F-150 LARIAT interior in Steel Gray with optional equipment.

In addition to front airbags in the Personal Safety System,™ the F-150 provides front-seat side airbags* and the Safety Canopy<sup>®</sup> System with its roll-fold technology. That’s six airbags in all.
F-150 Platinum interior in Pecan with optional equipment.
The F-150 4-door SuperCrew<sup>®</sup> carries up to six passengers, ideal for personal or commercial use. XLT model shown in Pale Adobe.

The Dual-Headrest DVD Entertainment System by INVISION™ includes two DVD headrest systems with 7-inch color LCD wide-screen monitors, top slot-loading players, two dual-channel infrared headphones and remote, game/video ports, wireless FM modulation to the vehicle’s stereo system, and CD/MP3 playback capability.*
F-150 XLT interior in Steel Gray with optional equipment.

exteriorImages.description: The Super Duty<sup>®</sup> LARIAT combines style, comfort and awesome performance. It’s a great looking truck for personal or commercial use.
The SelectShift<sup>®</sup> feature of the 6-speed TorqShift<sup>®</sup> automatic transmission can be set to lock out overdrive for consistent speed over hills and mountain ranges.

The class-exclusive* available integrated tailgate step stows inside the tailgate and can be easily accessed when needed. It includes a flip-up grab bar. With a 350-lb. load capacity, even the big guys don’t have to sweat it.
F-350 Super Duty<sup>®</sup> XLT Crew Cab in Blue Jeans.
The Electronic Shift-On-the-Fly (ESOF) Transfer Case 4-Wheel-Drive System with autolocking hubs lets you shift between 2WD and 4WD High or Low.
The available 6.7L Power Stroke<sup>®</sup> V8 Turbo Diesel and the 6.2L V8 gas engine were engineered and built to deliver excellent fuel economy.
Super Duty<sup>®</sup> LARIAT with the Chrome Package in Ruby Red Metallic Tinted Clearcoat.

Best-in-class horsepower and impressive torque.* And best-in-class fuel efficiency to go with all that power.** B20-capability plus clean and quiet operation too. That’s the available 6.7L Power Stroke<sup>®</sup> V8 Turbo Diesel.
The Ford Super Duty<sup>®</sup> delivers best-in-class maximum conventional towing (18,500 lbs.) and outstanding 5th-wheel (24,700 lbs.) towing capacities.
Super Duty<sup>®</sup> LARIAT Crew Cab in two-tone Kodiak Brown Metallic/Pale Adobe.
Super Duty<sup>®</sup> has best-in-class max 7,260-lb. payload capacity.*
The available 6.7L Power Stroke<sup>®</sup> V8 Turbo Diesel generates an awesome 800 lb.-ft. of torque and best-in-class 400 horsepower.*
The Ford Super Duty<sup>®</sup> delivers best-in-class maximum conventional towing and maximum payload.* This can have a huge impact on your bottom line.
All Super Duty<sup>®</sup> pickups come equipped with standard 4-wheel anti-lock brakes - plus AdvanceTrac<sup>®</sup> with Roll Stability Control™ on SRW models.
Super Duty<sup>®</sup> offers more configurations than any other heavy-duty full-size pickup.*
A rugged Built Ford Tough<sup>®</sup> frame and chassis are the foundation for the best-in-class* maximum payload capacity that Super Duty<sup>®</sup> pickups deliver.
Standard trailer sway control helps keep whatever you’re towing where it’s supposed to be - directly behind you.
All single-rear-wheel Super Duty<sup>®</sup> pickups come with standard AdvanceTrac<sup>®</sup> with Roll Stability Control.™
Super Duty<sup>®</sup> single-rear-wheel pickups come equipped with standard AdvanceTrac<sup>®</sup> with Roll Stability Control™ (RSC<sup>®</sup>).
Ford Super Duty<sup>®</sup> can be powered by either the standard 6.2L gas engine or the available 6.7L PowerStroke<sup>®</sup> V8 Turbo Diesel.

The Ford Super Duty<sup>®</sup> comes through in a big way in the everyday task of towing big loads, with best-in-class maximum conventional towing (18,500 lbs.). Maximum payload (7,260 lbs.) is best-inclass too.*
Super Duty<sup>®</sup> is synonymous with reliability, to help keep moving no matter what conditions you might encounter.
The rugged frame is the foundation for Ford Super Duty<sup>®</sup> toughness.
Tested for 250,000 miles. Willing to do many more.
Super Duty<sup>®</sup> pulls much more than its own weight on any job site.

Bursting through holes in the fabric of time and space is just one of the many chores you can trust Super Duty<sup>®</sup> to get done. Well, not exactly. But you get the idea of how much power and capability the Super Duty can bring to your real-world job.
Super Duty<sup>®</sup> LARIAT with the Chrome Package in Blue Jeans Tinted Clearcoat.
The available electronic locking rear differential locks the rear axle completely to maximize traction at both wheels simultaneously, providing excellent off-road traction in either 4x2 or 4x4 mode.
Class-exclusive* Hill Descent Control™ applies brake pressure as needed to descend grades at a controlled speed. Included on single-rear-wheel pickups with the available FX4 Off-Road Package.

For all its awesome performans, the Ford Super Duty<sup>®</sup> looks out for your bottom line with excellent fuel economy, whether it’s powered by the standard 6.2L gas V8 or the available 6.7L Power Stroke<sup>®</sup> V8 Turbo Diesel.
At work or play, nothing delivers like Super Duty.<sup>®</sup>

The XL Appearance Package includes an AM/FM stereo/single-CD/MP3 player/clock with four speakers, cruise control, chrome front and rear step bumpers, bright chrome hub covers and center ornaments (SRW only) and a bright chrome grille surround with black insert.

Super Duty<sup>®</sup> controls are work glove friendly.

exteriorImages.description: The 2013 Ford C-MAX Energi (shown in Ice Storm) makes an impression with its modern design and sporty style- even standing still.
Introducing the 2013 C-MAX Energi, the first-ever production plug-in hybrid electric vehicle by Ford. Shown in Ice Storm with optional features.

The first production plug-in hybrid vehicle from Ford, the C-MAX Energi is equipped with an illuminated charge port conveniently located near the driver’s door for easy plug-in access. When you plug the connector cord into the charge port, it activates the LED ring around the port to indicate that it’s connected. When the ring is flashing, it means a charge is in progress. When the ring is solidly lit, the vehicle is fully charged.
The 2013 C-MAX Hybrid SEL shown in Sterling Gray Metallic.

The available rear view camera provides a video image of the area behind your vehicle on a color touch screen. Color bars help you judge how far behind you objects are. The system works in conjunction with the Rear Parking Aid by alerting you with audio tones while you’re backing up.

The new, available foot-Activated Liftgate is incredibly easy to use. With the available Intelligent Access key in your pocket or purse, just place your foot under the bumper and the power liftgate will automatically open, providing easy access to the cargo area.
Once the available active park assist is activated, your C-MAX Hybrid or C-MAX Energi can virtually parallel park itself with little input from you. Shown with optional features.
The 2013 C-MAX Hybrid and C-MAX Energi set the stage for style, versatility and efficiency. C-MAX Hybrid shown in Sterling Gray. C-MAX Energi shown in Blue Candy.

The new powertrain includes a 2.0L I-4 Atkinson-cycle engine with an electric motor. Together they generate 188 total system horsepower, best-in-class* for the C-MAX Hybrid, delivering the responsive power you want when you need it. Even more impressive, C-MAX Hybrid has an EPA-estimated rating of up to 45 city/40 hwy/43 combined mpg.**
Using a combination of brake and/or engine control, all-speed traction control helps maximize available traction on slippery or loose surfaces. Standard on the new 2013 C-MAX Hybrid and C-MAX Energi.

AdvanceTrac<sup>®</sup> with Roll Stablity Control<sup>™</sup> is an electronic stability system that enhances control on slippery surfaces. It features a vehicle-roll-motion sensor that directly measures the vehicle’s roll rate at least 100 times every second.
The SOS Post-Crash Alert System<sup>™</sup> activates the horn and emergency flashers in the event of airbag deployment. After the system is activated, you may deactivate it using your key fob.
The C-MAX Hybrid and C-MAX Energi both benefit from powersplit architecture. This allows the vehicle to drive in either electric mode, gas mode, or a combination of both.
The Active Grille Shutters on the C-MAX help reduce air resistance and increase fuel efficiency.
2013 C-MAX Hybrid SEL shown in Ice Storm Metallic.

To charge the high-voltage, state-of-the-art lithium-ion battery of the C-MAX Energi more quickly, Ford recommends the optional 240-volt Leviton charging station. It’s compact and portable, making it easy to take along if you relocate.
How efficient is the 2013 C-MAX? Enough to get everyone talking. C-MAX Hybrid has an EPA estimated rating of up to 45 city/40 hwy/43 combined mpg.* That’s an EPA-estimated range of 522 miles.
C-MAX Hybrid SEL shown in Ruby Red Metallic Tinted Clearcoat.
The C-MAX Hybrid can operate electrically up to 85 miles per hour*, allowing the traction motor to power the vehicle, providing maximum efficiency.

interiorImages.description: The multi-activity vehicle design offers ample interior space and flexibility in the all-new five-passenger C-MAX. Shown with optional features.

The available 8-inch touch-screen display in the center stack allows the driver to easily engage, providing real-time information to help you get the most from your C-MAX Hybrid or C-MAX Energi. This high-tech design seamlessly interacts with all the other SYNC<sup>®</sup><sup>27</sup> functionality such as voice-activated calling, music, and much more.

The next-generation SmartGauge<sup>®</sup> with EcoGuide is the perfect companion to your C-MAX Hybrid or C-MAX Energi. The high-tech system provides real-time information featuring the next-generation design of green leaves growing across the screen on a lush green vine to indicate driving efficiency.
The second-row seat in the C-MAX Hybrid can easily and quickly be folded down with the 60/40 split, providing a flat load floor.
C-MAX is full of versatilty, inside and out. With a convenient 60/40 split in the second row seat, you have room for more cargo - when you need it.

C-MAX is clever as well as versatile. If you want to store smaller items and keep everything out of view, there’s hidden compartments in the footwell of the second row behind the first-row seats. Just lift up the floor mats and discover a smart hiding place for your PC tablet and other small items.
Bring the music along. The second-row seat in the C-MAX Hybrid can be easily and quickly folded down with the 60/40 split, providing a flat load floor.

Arms full and trying to open the liftgate? Not a problem. With the C-MAX Hybrid and C-MAX Energi, you have the convenience of a class exclusive* available foot-activated liftgate. With a simple kick of your foot under the bumper, the liftgate opens. No hands needed!
Let the sunshine in, thanks to the available panoramic fixed glass roof. A power sunshade is included and can be opened at the touch of a button.

To help keep you and your front-seat passenger comfortable when the mercury drops, opt for the heated front seats with four comfort settings. They’re standard on the C-MAX Hybrid SEL and C-MAX Energi; available with the cloth seats on the Hybrid SE in the Winter Package.
The C-MAX Hybrid SEL with leather-trimmed seats.

The Super Duty<sup>®</sup> LARIAT combines style, comfort and awesome performance. It’s a great looking truck for personal or commercial use.
Tested for 250,000 miles. Willing to do many more.

For all its awesome performance, the Ford Super Duty<sup>®</sup> looks out for your bottom line with excellent fuel economy, whether it’s powered by the standard 6.2L gas V8 or the available 6.7L Power Stroke<sup>®</sup> V8 Turbo Diesel.
The available 6.7L Power Stroke<sup>®</sup> V8 Turbo Diesel generates an awesome 800 lb.-ft. of torque and best-in-class 400 horsepower.*
Standard trailer sway control helps keep your trailer directly behind you.
The SelectShift<sup>®</sup> feature of the 6-speed TorqShift<sup>®</sup> automatic transmission can be set to lock out overdrive for consistent speed over hills and mountain ranges.
Super Duty<sup>®</sup> offers more configurations than any other heavy-duty full-size pickup.*
Super Duty<sup>®</sup> LARIAT Crew Cab in two-tone Kodiak Brown Metallic/Pale Adobe.

Super Duty<sup>®</sup> single-rear-wheel pickups come equipped with standard AdvanceTrac<sup>®</sup> with
Roll Stability Control™ (RSC<sup>®</sup>).<sup>39</sup>
The available 6.7L Power Stroke<sup>®</sup> V8 Turbo Diesel and the 6.2L V8 gas engine were engineered and built to deliver excellent fuel economy.
All Super Duty<sup>®</sup> pickups come equipped with standard 4-wheel anti-lock brakes - plus AdvanceTrac<sup>®</sup> with Roll Stability Control™ on SRW models.
Super Duty<sup>®</sup> pulls much more than its own weight on any job site.

The class-exclusive* available integrated tailgate step stows inside the tailgate and can be
easily accessed when needed. It includes a flip-up grab bar. With a 350-lb. load capacity,
even the big guys don’t have to sweat it.
All Super Duty<sup>®</sup> pickups come with standard AdvanceTrac<sup>®</sup> with Roll Stability Control.™
At work or play, nothing delivers like Super Duty.<sup>®</sup>

Bursting through holes in the fabric of time and space is just one of the many chores you can trust Super Duty<sup>®</sup> to get done. Well, not exactly. But you get the idea of how much power and capability the Super Duty can bring to your real-world job.

Super Duty<sup>®</sup> LARIAT with the Chrome Package in Ruby Red Metallic Tinted Clearcoat.

and haul it easily.
The Super Duty<sup>®</sup> Platinum Crew Cab in Ruby Red Metallic Tinted Clearcoat.
The Ford Super Duty<sup>®</sup> delivers exceptional 5th-wheel towing capability (24,700 lbs.).
Available 20-inch chrome-clad aluminum wheels.

Best-in-class horsepower and impressive torque.* And best-in-class fuel efficiency to go with all that power.** B20-capability plus clean and quiet operation too. That’s the available 6.7L Power Stroke<sup>®</sup> Turbo Diesel V8.
F-350 Super Duty<sup>®</sup> DRW King Ranch<sup>®</sup> with Chrome Package at the King Ranch in Texas.
A rugged Built Ford Tough<sup>®</sup> frame and chassis are the foundation for the best-in-class* maximum payload capacity that Super Duty<sup>®</sup> pickups deliver.

Ford Super Duty<sup>®</sup> can be powered by either the standard 6.2L gas engine or the available
6.7L PowerStroke<sup>®</sup> Turbo Diesel V8.

The Super Duty<sup>®</sup> King Ranch<sup>®</sup> comes with heated/cooled Chaparral leather 40/ console/40 front seats and 60/40 rear bench seat, leather-wrapped steering wheel with Ford SYNC<sup>®</sup> controls, adjustable pedals with memory, rear view camera, and much more.
Steering wheel-mounted controls allow you to easily access valuable information.
Available voice-controlled SYNC<sup>®</sup> with MyFord Touch<sup>®</sup> provides hands-on-the-wheel, eyes-on-the-road functionality.
Super Duty controls are work glove friendly.
Super Duty<sup>®</sup> Platinum comes with premium heated/cooled leather-trimmed front seats with 10-way power-adjustable controls.
Super Duty<sup>®</sup> Platinum has a Brown Olive Ash woodgrain appliqué center stack.

Four-way adjustable driver and passenger head restraints are standard in Super Duty<sup>®</sup> XLT,
LARIAT, King Ranch<sup>®</sup> and Platinum models.
Innovative storage includes available 1st- and 2nd-row under-seat storage and lockable center console option.
Spaciousness and comfort come standard in the Ford Super Duty.<sup>®</sup>

The Super Duty<sup>®</sup> Crew Cab model has four doors and seats five or six passengers depending on the front seating arrangement. The rear seat backs fold forward for extra cargo space when needed.

The Super Duty<sup>®</sup> Crew Cab model provides the convenience of 4-door access and seating
for a crew of up to six people (5-passenger configuration shown with 40/console/40 front
seat).

For Super Duty<sup>®</sup> toughness and maximum value, the standard XL model is your choice. It comes with 40/20/40 heavy-duty vinyl split bench seat with center armrest, cupholder and storage, driver lumbar support, tilting/telescoping steering wheel, and more.

Among the features in the Super Duty<sup>®</sup> Platinum are these premium heated/cooled leather trimmed front seats with unique sew style and 10-way power-adjustable controls. PLATINUM is embroidered on the front and rear seat backs.

The Super Duty<sup>®</sup> Platinum puts emphasis on driver comfort and convenience, with features such as standard heated/cooled front seats, a heated steering wheel, Ford SYNC<sup>®</sup> with MyFordTouch<sup>®</sup> and PowerScope<sup>®</sup> trailer tow mirrors.

The Super Duty<sup>®</sup> Platinum comes with premium features in addition to its unique trim, including SYNC<sup>®</sup> with MyFord Touch<sup>®</sup> with a high-definition 8-inch center-stack display plus audio/video input jacks, 12-volt powerpoint, WiFi<sup>®</sup> capability and two USB ports.
Wi-Fi is a registered trademark of the Wi-Fi Alliance.<sup>®</sup>

The Super Duty<sup>®</sup> Platinum comes with standard heated/cooled front seats, a heated steering wheel, SYNC<sup>®</sup> with MyFordTouch<sup>®</sup> and PowerScope<sup>®</sup> trailer tow mirrors.

The Super Duty<sup>®</sup> Platinum features a unique instrument center-stack panel. Navigation System, Ford SYNC<sup>®</sup> with MyFord Touch<sup>®</sup> and an 8-inch touch screen are standard.

The Super Duty<sup>®</sup> Platinum comes with premium features in addition to its unique trim, including MyFord Touch<sup>®</sup> with the its high-definition 8-inch center-stack display and WiFi<sup>®</sup><sup>48</sup> capability. The upper closable media hub includes two USB ports, SD card reader, audio/video input jacks and 12-volt powerpoint.

exteriorImages.description: E-Series Stripped Chassis vehicles are available in three wheelbases (138, 158 or 176 inches) and offer a range of GVWRs (11,500 or 12,500 on the E-350; 14,000 or 14,500 on the E-450) to match your application.
Commercial and municipal utility services are among the large number of applications that depend on the quality and durability of a Ford F-59 Commercial Stripped Chassis.
The F-53 Motorhome Stripped Chassis is powered by a standard 6.8L Triton<sup>®</sup> 3-valve EFI V10 mated to a 5-speed TorqShift<sup>®</sup> automatic transmission with tow/haul mode.
E-Series Stripped Chassis models provide the solid foundation for the wide variety of van delivery vehicles you see on the road.

E-Series Stripped Chassis offer GVWRs ranging from 11,500 and 12,500 lbs. (E-350) to 14,000 and 14,500 lbs. (E-450). Choose the standard 5.4L Triton<sup>®</sup> V8 or optional 6.8L Triton V10 engine, both mated to a rugged TorqShift<sup>®</sup> automatic transmission with tow/haul mode.
The F-59 Commercial Stripped Chassis features a standard 6.8L Triton<sup>®</sup> 3-valve V10.
When you see a Class A motorhome, chances are extremely good it’s on a Ford F-53 Motorhome Stripped Chassis (shown).
Built Ford Tough<sup>®</sup> means business in commercial as well as recreational applications. Class A motorhome shown on a Ford F-53 Motorhome Stripped Chassis.
E-350 and E-450 Stripped Chassis offer GVWRs from 11,500 to 14,500 lbs.
E-350 and E-450 Stripped Chassis offer wheelbases from 138 to 176 inches and GVWRs from 11,500 to 14,500 lbs.

The E-Series Stripped Chassis comes available in wheelbases from 138 inches (E-350) to 176 inches (E-450). Maximum payload is 9,747 lbs. (less body weight). Need greater capacity? There’s the F-59 Commercial Stripped Chassis with wheelbases from 158 inches to 208 inches and a maximum payload of 15,621 lbs. Note: Aftermarket ramp (shown) requires Ramp Prep Package.

The F-53 Motorhome Stripped Chassis (shown) and F-59 Commercial Stripped Chassis have a solid I-beam axle with multileaf springs. Front suspension on the E-350 and E-450 Stripped Chassis models is the proven Twin I-Beam independent system with computer-selected coil springs and stabilizer bar.
The under-frame location of the fuel tank is a feature that makes upfitting a body to a Ford stripped chassis convenient.
E-350 and E-450 Stripped Chassis offer wheelbases from 138 to 176 inches.

E-Series Stripped Chassis is available in wheelbases from 138 inches in the E-350 to 176 inches in the E-450. Maximum payload is 9,747 lbs. (less body weight). Need greater capacity? There’s the F-59 Commercial Stripped Chassis with wheelbases from 158 inches to 208 inches and a maximum payload of 15,621 lbs. (less body weight).
E-Series Stripped Chassis models begin with the E-350. GVWRs range from 11,500 and 12,500 lbs. (E-350).
The E-350 Super Duty<sup>®</sup> Stripped Chassis comes in three wheelbases: 138, 158 and 176 inches.
E-350 (shown) and E-450 Stripped Chassis offer GVWRs from 11,500 to 14,500 lbs.
The F-53 Motorhome Stripped Chassis offers a range of GVWRs from 16,000 to 26,000 lbs. Available aluminum wheels shown.
The F-53 Motorhome Stripped Chassis offers seven wheelbases: 158, 178, 190, 208, 228, 242 and 252 inches.
The F-53 Motorhome Stripped Chassis offers seven wheelbases: 158, 178, 190, 208, 228, 242 and 252 inches.
The F-59 Commercial Stripped Chassis offers four wheelbases: 158, 178, 190 and 208 inches.
The F-59 Commercial Stripped Chassis offers four wheelbases: 158, 178, 190 and 208 inches.

E-350 and E-450 Stripped Chassis feature a power-assisted recirculating ball steering system. In the F-53 Motorhome and F-59 Commercial Stripped Chassis is a TRW system with heavy-duty steering gear, large linkage and pitman arms, and power assist with cooler.
Ford stripped chassis are designed with features such as under-frame location of the fuel tank to make body installation as easy as possible.

The 5.4L Triton<sup>®</sup> V8, shown, is mated to a 5-speed TorqShift<sup>®</sup> automatic transmission. It features a rugged torque converter and large-capacity fluid pump for optimal cooling and durability. The tow/haul mode automatically compensates for altitude, grade and load conditions, and delays transmission upshifts to help reduce the frequency of gear hunting.
The 6.8L 3-valve Triton<sup>®</sup> V10 is standard on the F-53 Motorhome Stripped Chassis and F-59 Commercial Stripped Chassis. It generates an impressive 362 horsepower and 457 lb.- ft. of torque.
